title: City of Berkeley ADA Procedure Information

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All written procedures for accommodation of disabilities of City of Berkeley programs. E.g. All written procedures under the Americans With Disability Act.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson

title: Plans to arrest Cambodian guerrilla leader Pol Pot of the Khmer Rouge (U.S. Department of State)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I hereby request any and all documents related plans put forward by the administration of President Bill Clinton to arrest Pol Pot, the leader of the Cambodia’s Khmer Rouge guerilla organization.

The date range would be between January 1, 1998 and December 31, 1998.

Independent sources corroborate the existence of this material:

https://www.nytimes.com/1998/04/11/world/us-seeks-china-s-help-in-arranging-pol-pot-trial.html

https://www.nytimes.com/1998/04/09/world/us-is-planning-a-move-to-seize-pol-pot-for-trial.html

https://www.thelocal.se/20090803/21064?gaa_at=eafs&gaa_n=ASWzDAhD433qJE7jn11-t-pDGtozLpexpu-EpCu_sTN0uuOTgxK60DUzVZjT9vXukYw%3D&gaa_ts=684c7ea7&gaa_sig=_2iAUGRRptAMw1CgRfsQ_GU-oDNTh6MLizvQP84mWR0Obov1I5EEL0S9mg-vaeNPlWj-qD-JcsxeQpNH1qROuA%3D%3D


I also hereby request any documents kept in “prohibited access”  filing systems, separated from conventional filing systems (such as Sentinel) in violation of FOIA laws.

Given that 27 years have passed since these files were generated, I expect them to be provided in full, without redactions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mary Patricia Nunan
